channel.title: Whonix-Cli gateway error upgrade
channel.description:
Host - Debian 9 / VB 6
after entering the command: $ sudo apt-get-update-plus dist-upgrade
4 new packages are installed and 2 upgraded But in the end, the process hangs on the next: *Deleting system.map files ...* *removed '/boot/System.map-4.19.0-9-amd64'* *Done. Success.*
Further the cursor blinks. Nothing happens for hours.

item.title: Whonix-Cli gateway error upgrade
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Yes, more RAM may be required during upgrades. RAM only. Video RAM
should be irrelevant for CLI gateway.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix-Cli gateway error upgrade
item.dc:creator: u896265715
item.description:
Need VB-guest-sys set more ram - >1024 gb
and more video - 128 mb

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix-Cli gateway error upgrade
item.dc:creator: u896265715
item.description:
Checked now in Whonix-Workstation-Cli
However, I did not introduce at first:
$ sudo apt-get update
$ sudo apt-get upgrade
$ sudo apt-get dist-upgrade

The command was immediately entered:
$ sudo apt-get-update-plus dist-upgrade

As a result, no freeze occurred.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix-Cli gateway error upgrade

item.description:
Host - Debian 9 / VB 6

after entering the command:
$ sudo apt-get-update-plus dist-upgrade

4 new packages are installed and 2 upgraded
But in the end, the process hangs on the next:
Deleting system.map files …
removed ‘/boot/System.map-4.19.0-9-amd64’
Done. Success.

Further the cursor blinks. Nothing happens for hours.
